what-is-i18n.bullet2: The process of designing software so that it may be adapted into other languages

what-is-l10n.bullet2: The process of adapting i18n prepared software into multiple languages
what-is-l10n.bullet4: Translations are typically stored in json or xml files

with-i18n.example1: The example below uses Angular with ngx-translate
with-i18n.example2: This one uses React with i18next

without-i18n.example: The example below uses no i18n

slide4.body: Sometimes it can be useful to pass a parameter or two to the translation

slide5.part1: It can be cumbersome to manually maintain translation files during development...

slide6.body: Tools like BabelEdit can be very useful to maintain translation files
slide6.header: ... but there are tools for that!

slide7.body: Keep in mind that not all languages use the Latin alphabet or are written left to right

slide8.button-dk: Click to change language to English
slide8.button-en: Click to change language to Danish
